page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS - IDEN GREEN
page.content: OIL EXPLORATION in Iden Green. July 20, 1983, Conoco UK was awarded the right to search for oil in this area. After preliminary echo sounding Moor Wood (814315) was thought geologically likely to yield hydrocarbons and planning permission for an exploratory bore hole was sought. Such exploration and the possibility of finding deposits worth exploiting created serious concern among some residents, particularly those in the immediate vicinity. A pressure group - Benenden Society was formed to fight this.Meetings were held by them - Parish Council,KCC, Planning Committees. Permission was granted - 26 conditions to safeguard environment and safety. Exploration ran from September - November 1985. No deposits found and land restored.
